reference.title: glossScopeNote
reference.shortdesc: The <glossScopeNote> element contains a clarification of the subject designated by the <glossterm>, such as examples of included or excluded companies or products. For instance, a scope note for "Linux" might explain that the term doesn't apply to UNIX products and may give some examples of Linux products that are included as well as UNIX products that are excluded.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <glossentry id="linuxOS" xml:lang="en-us"> <glossterm>Linux Operating System</glossterm> <glossdef>An operating system based on the kernel created by Linus Torvald.</glossdef> <glossBody> <glossPartOfSpeech value="noun"/> <glossScopeNote>Doesn't apply to UNIX products that bundle other kernels. Also, doesn't apply to the Linux Open Source Project that work on Linux distributions but, instead, only to the distributions themselves. Examples include RedHat, SuSE, and Ubuntu. </glossScopeNote> </glossBody> </glossentry>
